title: Possible CSRF during external programs

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:

activities.message:
Hi @malcolmx,

We've taken a look at your report and noticed your requests are still sent with the `X-CSRF-Token` header - could you please re-test and confirm that you can make requests without that header?

Have a good weekend!
-@asuka

Hi @asuka 
I work without the other token (not on the header)

Hi @malcomx,

I still don't follow: please confirm you can submit successfully without the header **and** the form token.

-@asuka

Hi @asuka 
I said at first on my report that my bug is the same as this #148517
__The Difference__: that on this bug #148517 that here the request can do without the Token on the header

but on my report the request can do without the token on the post
i think that you will accept it like the other bug #148517

but it seems that you will not accept it so i will close it

Hi @malcomx,

This bug should really have been closed as informative as it isn't a security issue (it just looks silly sending the tokens twice). We will not be fixing this bug in this instance as it poses no security issues.

Thanks!
-@asuka

Hi @asuka 
but my bug is the same like this #148517 and you fixed it
did you will fix it like #148517 ?

Hi @malcomx,

As I said in my above reply:

>This bug should really have been closed as informative as it isn't a security issue (it just looks silly sending the tokens twice). We will not be fixing this bug in this instance as it poses no security issues.

To clarify, by `This bug` I was referring to #148517.

Cheers,
-@asuka
but this bug #148517 closed as a Resolved and rewarded with Swag

Hi @malcomx,

As I have said before, the bug **should** have been closed as informative as it doesn't impose security issues, but after we'd already accepted it, we decided to resolve it as ineligible for bounty. 

We will not be accepting this bug, and I'm locking this report as any further conversation isn't necessary.

Cheers,
-@asuka

Hello Hackerone Team,

my bug is the same #148517 but you accepted it and not accept my bug I'm don't know why?

Sorry for the back-and-forth here, but we've corrected this issue as part of our defense-in-depth strategy, similar to #103787 and #148517.

Can you confirm that this is fixed on your end?

@reed 
Thank you, yes it fixed Now
sorry for Request public 
but you locked my report
Hmm, doesn't seem to be a way for me to unlock reports. I'll file that as a feature request. I do apologize.

This is the same issue as #148517 but affects some other endpoints. We've fixed this issue and audited all other endpoints as well to make sure we didn't have additional ones with duplicate CSRF fields. We consider this defense-in-depth, as there's no actual security issue, but we just want to remove any possible cases where a security issue could use the extra CSRF field to chain exploits together.
